summary: Bert Mills is a former CIA employee who retired under cover and resided in various locations, including Vienna, Mexico City, and Bangkok. The CIA sought to contact Mills because his name appeared in documents being reviewed for public release under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992. The purpose of contacting him was to inform him of the potential release of his name and offer him an opportunity to provide reasons why his name should not be released. The documents suggest a pattern of the CIA contacting former employees who retired under cover to inform them about the potential release of their names in JFK assassination-related documents.
significance: Bert Mills' significance in the JFK context lies in his status as a former CIA employee whose name appeared in documents related to the JFK assassination records. The CIA's efforts to contact him suggest that his past activities or knowledge were considered relevant to the records being reviewed for public release.
